dailyToll.methodologyNote: Where direct 'corruption-only' daily values are not published, we derived conservative estimates from official audits, CIAA case filings, and sectoral effect studies (MoHP neonatal and avoidable mortality data, Auditor General procurement losses), then averaged to daily figures.

livesLost.description: Estimated additional avoidable deaths every 10 days in Nepal attributable to systemic corruption impacts on healthcare access and procurement over the last observed period.

metricSources.note: Ministry of Health national mortality and maternal/neonatal statistics used as baseline; World Bank and HRW warnings on COVID-era procurement failures used to estimate corruption contribution (method: conservative 1–3% of avoidable deaths attributable to procurement failures and service leakage).

moneyWasted.description: Estimated average daily value of funds lost to procurement irregularities, inflated contracts, and misappropriation (based on Auditor General multi-billion findings and historic CIAA investigations).

metricSources.note: Derived from OAG and CIAA reports indicating multi-billion-NPR anomalies (example: TSC case ~NPR 10.02 billion referenced in OAG/CIAA historical reporting) and known large procurements such as passports/contracts (2024-2025). Calculation: conservative annual leakage estimate of ~NPR 438 billion/year -> daily = ~NPR 1.2b (rounded). See limitations.

childrenWithoutEducation.description: Estimated number of children (primary-school-aged) further deprived of education each day due to diversion of school funding, teacher salary leakage, and procurement failures in education inputs.

metricSources.note: Estimate based on Ministry of Education access/attendance gaps and Auditor General findings on misallocated education funds; converted to daily cadence to demonstrate human scale.

familiesInPoverty.description: Estimated number of families being pushed below national poverty thresholds each day due to lost services, health expenditure shocks, and public money diversion.

metricSources.note: Based on NPC poverty lines, World Bank macro impacts of leakage, and a conservative fraction of leakage-driven shocks to households. This is an inferential estimate and flagged low-confidence.

casesInvestigated.description: Number of active corruption/abuse-of-authority investigations tracked across federal & provincial levels (CIAA + OAG referrals + public court filings aggregated).

moneyRecovered.description: Funds formally recovered or secured via restitution, asset freeze, or court-ordered recovery in anti-corruption actions for the period of recent enforcement cycles.

communitiesHelped.description: Number of local-level communities receiving targeted remediation, transparency training, or restitution programs following exposed corruption (government/NGO partnership projects).

volunteersActive.description: Registered or active anti-corruption volunteers, community monitors, and CSO field investigators across Nepal participating in oversight projects and whistle-blower monitoring.

featuredCase.title: Patanjali / Kavrepalanchok Public Land Misuse & Multi-actor Case (CIAA referral)
featuredCase.summary: High-profile land deal flagged by CIAA involving public land use and alleged misuse of office; multi-party case with Special Court filings and high-level individuals listed among 93+ defendants in affiliated cases.
featuredCase.status: active - CIAA filed cases / Special Court filings (2024-2025 filings referenced)

caseStudies.title: Civil Savings & Credit Cooperative fraud and money-laundering (Ichchha Raj Tamang case)
caseStudies.summary: Fraud and money-laundering conviction of cooperative promoter; widespread depositor losses and multiple criminal and civil claims.
caseStudies.humanImpactNarrative: Over 1,500 depositors reported losing savings; many households lost emergency funds, affecting health and education spending.
caseStudies.investigationStatus: convictions and ongoing asset recovery; Special Court proceedings (2024 conviction reported)

caseStudies.title: Tax Settlement Commission (TSC) scandal – embezzlement claims (historic large-scale case)
caseStudies.summary: CIAA investigation of Tax Settlement Commission members regarding irregular tax settlement files; public interest termed the largest corruption case (reported embezzled figure: ~NPR 10.02 billion in initial charges).
caseStudies.humanImpactNarrative: Large-scale revenue leakage reduces fiscal capacity for public services; long-term crowding-out of education & health spending.
caseStudies.investigationStatus: Special Court filings; extended inquiries and fines demanded by authorities (ongoing legal processes in subsequent years).

caseStudies.title: Passport / e-passport procurement controversy (2024–2025 procurements)
caseStudies.summary: Large multi-billion-NPR passport printing & eMRTDS contracts flagged for procurement anomalies and alleged favouritism; OAG flagged portions, multiple bidders complained.
caseStudies.humanImpactNarrative: Procurement anomalies delayed passport issuance, affecting travel for workers and students; potential reputational & economic losses for remittance-dependent households.
caseStudies.investigationStatus: PPMO complaints received; Auditor General flagged deal; public petitions and media scrutiny ongoing (2024-2025).

caseStudies.title: Health procurement failures and COVID-era supply concerns (2020–2023 onward)
caseStudies.summary: Multiple reports and watchdog warnings highlighted weak procurement controls during the pandemic, raising the risk of substandard supplies and delayed care.
caseStudies.province: Nationwide (major hospitals concentrated in Bagmati, Province 1, Lumbini)
caseStudies.moneyUnits: NPR (aggregate example for dysfunctional contracts and inflated prices used as conservative estimate)
caseStudies.humanImpactNarrative: Delayed or substandard PPE, oxygen, and medicine procurement increased avoidable morbidity and mortality during crisis peaks; poor procurement also reduced trust and access for the poorest.
caseStudies.investigationStatus: Multiple audits and NGO calls for investigations (HRW, Amnesty, MoHP monitored procurement policies after 2020).

caseStudies.title: Cooperative frauds and depositor losses (multi-district cooperative collapses)
caseStudies.summary: Series of cooperative frauds across provinces leading to depositors losing life-savings; parliamentary probe committees and fraud probe committee activity reported in 2024.
caseStudies.humanImpactNarrative: Depositors lost savings and became unable to pay school fees or medical costs, causing downstream socioeconomic harms.
caseStudies.investigationStatus: Parliamentary committee probes; Special Court/anti-money-laundering filings against promoters (2022-2024).

testimonials.text: My child was turned away from the district hospital because they did not have the necessary pediatric antibiotic stocked. We paid out-of-pocket at a private clinic and drained our savings. We were later told the hospital procurement was delayed due to contract disputes.
testimonials.collectorOrganization: Local community monitor partnered with Transparency International regional contact (media corroboration in local reporting)
testimonials.verificationMethods: Interview + cross-reference with hospital stock audit in MoHP regional report + local news reporting

testimonials.text: I kept my life savings in a cooperative. When it collapsed, it was like someone had taken away our safety net — school fees, rent, everything. The police asked us to file paperwork. We are still waiting.
testimonials.collectorOrganization: Kathmandu Post / on-the-record depositor testimonies; corroborated by Special Court filings
testimonials.verificationMethods: Media interview transcripts + Special Court docket references + CIAA complaint logs

testimonials.text: School stationary and teacher incentives were cut after municipal funds were diverted to 'emergency' projects that never materialised. Children missed weeks of learning.
testimonials.collectorOrganization: Local NGO partner / field surveys aggregated and cross-checked with municipal audit findings
testimonials.verificationMethods: NGO field reports + Auditor General local-level audit excerpts

methodology.researchPhase: Searched and collected primary reports from CIAA, Office of the Auditor General, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Education, National Planning Commission, Transparency International, World Bank, Amnesty, HRW, and leading Nepali media outlets (Kathmandu Post, Himalayan Times, Nepali Times, Reuters). Priority given to 2023-2025 publications or to earlier case files that remain active.
methodology.validationPhase: Cross-referenced each high-impact data point with at least one government source (CIAA/OAG/MoHP/MoE/NPC) and one reputable NGO/media source where possible. Flagged confidence levels (high/medium/low) and documented source URLs in the dataset.
methodology.structuringPhase: Converted verified figures into the JSON structure requested. Monetary values normalized to NPR and population/household impacts expressed in per-day or per-month units where requested.
methodology.reviewPhase: All included URLs were checked on 2025-09-18 during data assembly. Where a number is an estimate or derived, the derivation and confidence flag are included.
methodology.outputPhase: This JSON is pretty-printed, dates in YYYY-MM-DD, no comments in JSON, victim names anonymized.

notesAndLimitations.1: Some human-impact attributions (e.g., daily deaths explicitly 'caused by corruption') are inferential; exact causation cannot be determined from public sources alone. Values provided for such items are conservative estimates with confidence flags.
notesAndLimitations.2: All monetary aggregations (e.g., daily leakage estimate) are constructed from audit findings and known large-contract values; these should be re-calculated when new OAG/CIAA annual statements are published.
notesAndLimitations.3: Testimonial identities have been anonymized to protect victims; full records exist in media / NGO repositories and are referenced in 'sources' where possible.
notesAndLimitations.4: This dataset focuses on 2023–2025 primary sources where available; older cases are included only when they remain material to systemic patterns (e.g., TSC 2017 case).

updateGuidelines.dailyToll: Recalculate monthly using OAG/CIAA monthly summaries and sectoral ministry updates (MoHP, MoE).
updateGuidelines.caseStudies: Add new cases when CIAA/OAG files new Special Court referrals or when investigative journalism uncovers new validated data.
updateGuidelines.sources: Verify and update URLs quarterly; replace 'pending' verification statuses as documents are cleared.
updateGuidelines.impactMetrics: Recalculate annually in conjunction with NPC and World Bank national accounting cycles.
